author: aldekein
content:
Hey! Unfortunately, there's no such functionality in Gitter. The available actions are:
- removing the room
- changing a room tagline (current is "Java implementation of the Ethereum protocol")
- exporting room data (users, messages)

author: trent_vanepps
content: i think it's fine to remove the room given the client is no longer being developed

author: trent_vanepps
content: after checking with the repo owners

author: trent_vanepps
content: i would also archive the room history for posterity

author: lightclient
content: <@&595685821026271242> not sure if there is anything to be done about this, but it seems like this server is seeing more and more users who are pretty removed from the purpose of the server but they want to share their 2 cents. This seems to happen most commonly in <#745077610685661265>. I feel like I'm skipping almost every third message in a discussion there because the posts are barely relevant to the discussion at hand.

author: trent_vanepps
content: yup, threw up a message a few minutes ago related to that.

author: joshuaisbuilding
content: One option that we‚Äôre looking to explore on the Ethereum.org discord is just reordering the channels. Lazy users will post in the first channel that they think *might* be suitable for their query so having a buffer ‚Äògeneral‚Äô channel before allcoredevs might help with this.

author: joshuaisbuilding
content: Other than that - required roles to post in certain channels (which, whilst it would work, I don‚Äôt love the idea of)

author: trent_vanepps
content: This actually isn‚Äôt a bad idea! Anyone can still read, but write access people almost all have a role already (EG. Client teams)

author: joshuaisbuilding
content: Well if there was a mechanism for getting added to the role that had 100% acceptance I think that would probably create *just enough* friction to remove the majority of low value posts without closing the possibility of open discourse

author: joshuaisbuilding
content: On second thought, closing it off to accepted participants is probably better...
